explains: n. 体面；可尊敬；有社会地位

sentences.en: If she divorced Tony, she would lose the respectability she had as Mrs. Tony Tatterton.
sentences.cn: 如果她和托尼离婚，她将会失去作为托尼•塔特顿太太的体面。

sentences.en: He longed to throw off the mask of respectability.
sentences.cn: 他渴望丢掉那副道貌岸然的伪装。

sentences.en: On the other hand, Swiss bankers do want respectability.
sentences.cn: 另一方面，瑞士的银行家们也的确渴望得到尊重。
